pipr

Source: vignettes/pipr.Rmd
pipr.Rmd
library(pipr)
#> Info: Session based caching is enabled.

The pipr package allows to easily query the PIP API from R.

Here are a few examples to get you started:

Using default options

By default, get_stats() returns all available

  • countries
  • reporting levels (national, urban, rural)
  • for all available survey years
  • at the 1.9 USD poverty line
get_stats()
#> # A tibble: 2,028 × 40
#>    regio…¹ regio…² count…³ count…⁴  year repor…⁵ surve…⁶ surve…⁷ welfa…⁸ welfa…⁹
#>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1 Sub-Sa… SSA     Angola  AGO      2000 nation… HBS     nation…   2000. consum…
#>  2 Sub-Sa… SSA     Angola  AGO      2008 nation… IBEP-M… nation…   2008. consum…
#>  3 Sub-Sa… SSA     Angola  AGO      2018 nation… IDREA   nation…   2018. consum…
#>  4 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      1996 nation… EWS     nation…   1996  consum…
#>  5 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2002 nation… LSMS    nation…   2002  consum…
#>  6 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2005 nation… LSMS    nation…   2005  consum…
#>  7 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2008 nation… LSMS    nation…   2008  consum…
#>  8 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2012 nation… LSMS    nation…   2012  consum…
#>  9 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2014 nation… HBS     nation…   2014  consum…
#> 10 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2015 nation… HBS     nation…   2015  consum…
#> # … with 2,018 more rows, 30 more variables: survey_comparability <dbl>,
#> #   comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>,
#> #   median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>,
#> #   decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>,
#> #   decile7 <dbl>, decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, cpi <dbl>,
#> #   ppp <dbl>, pop <dbl>, gdp <dbl>, hfce <dbl>, is_interpolated <lgl>, …

Basic options

Filter by country 

# Specify ONE country
get_stats(country = "ALB")
#> # A tibble: 14 × 40
#>    regio…¹ regio…² count…³ count…⁴  year repor…⁵ surve…⁶ surve…⁷ welfa…⁸ welfa…⁹
#>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      1996 nation… EWS     nation…    1996 consum…
#>  2 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2002 nation… LSMS    nation…    2002 consum…
#>  3 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2005 nation… LSMS    nation…    2005 consum…
#>  4 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2008 nation… LSMS    nation…    2008 consum…
#>  5 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2012 nation… LSMS    nation…    2012 consum…
#>  6 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2014 nation… HBS     nation…    2014 consum…
#>  7 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2015 nation… HBS     nation…    2015 consum…
#>  8 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2016 nation… HBS     nation…    2016 consum…
#>  9 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2016 nation… SILC-C  nation…    2016 income 
#> 10 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2017 nation… HBS     nation…    2017 consum…
#> 11 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2017 nation… SILC-C  nation…    2017 income 
#> 12 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2018 nation… HBS     nation…    2018 consum…
#> 13 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2018 nation… SILC-C  nation…    2018 income 
#> 14 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2019 nation… HBS     nation…    2019 consum…
#> # … with 30 more variables: survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>,
#> #   poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>,
#> #   gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>,
#> #   decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>,
#> #   decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, cpi <dbl>, ppp <dbl>,
#> #   pop <dbl>, gdp <dbl>, hfce <dbl>, is_interpolated <lgl>, …

# Specify MULTIPLE countries
get_stats(country = c("ALB", "CHN"))
#> # A tibble: 74 × 40
#>    regio…¹ regio…² count…³ count…⁴  year repor…⁵ surve…⁶ surve…⁷ welfa…⁸ welfa…⁹
#>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>

#>  2 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2002 nation… LSMS    nation…    2002 consum…

#>  4 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2008 nation… LSMS    nation…    2008 consum…
#>  5 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2012 nation… LSMS    nation…    2012 consum…
#>  6 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2014 nation… HBS     nation…    2014 consum…

#> 10 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2017 nation… HBS     nation…    2017 consum…
#> # … with 64 more rows, 30 more variables: survey_comparability <dbl>,
#> #   comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>,
#> #   median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>,
#> #   decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>,
#> #   decile7 <dbl>, decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, cpi <dbl>,
#> #   ppp <dbl>, pop <dbl>, gdp <dbl>, hfce <dbl>, is_interpolated <lgl>, …

Filter by year

By default, get_stats will only return data if a survey is available for the requested country and the requested year.

# Survey year available
get_stats(country = "ALB", year = 2012)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 40
#>   region…¹ regio…² count…³ count…⁴  year repor…⁵ surve…⁶ surve…⁷ welfa…⁸ welfa…⁹
#>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>  
#> 1 Europe … ECA     Albania ALB      2012 nation… LSMS    nation…    2012 consum…
#> # … with 30 more variables: survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>,
#> #   poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>,
#> #   gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>,
#> #   decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>,
#> #   decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, cpi <dbl>, ppp <dbl>,
#> #   pop <dbl>, gdp <dbl>, hfce <dbl>, is_interpolated <lgl>, …

# Survey year NOT available - Empty response
get_stats(country = "ALB", year = 2000)
#> # A tibble: 0 × 40
#> # … with 40 variables: region_name <chr>, region_code <chr>,
#> #   country_name <chr>, country_code <chr>, year <dbl>, reporting_level <chr>,
#> #   survey_acronym <chr>, survey_coverage <chr>, welfare_time <dbl>,
#> #   welfare_type <chr>, survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>,
#> #   poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>,
#> #   gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>, …

Modify the poverty line 

get_stats(country = "ALB", povline = 3.2)
#> # A tibble: 14 × 40
#>    regio…¹ regio…² count…³ count…⁴  year repor…⁵ surve…⁶ surve…⁷ welfa…⁸ welfa…⁹
#>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      1996 nation… EWS     nation…    1996 consum…
#>  2 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2002 nation… LSMS    nation…    2002 consum…
#>  3 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2005 nation… LSMS    nation…    2005 consum…
#>  4 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2008 nation… LSMS    nation…    2008 consum…
#>  5 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2012 nation… LSMS    nation…    2012 consum…
#>  6 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2014 nation… HBS     nation…    2014 consum…
#>  7 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2015 nation… HBS     nation…    2015 consum…
#>  8 Europe… ECA     Albania ALB      2016 nation… HBS     nation…    2016 consum…

#> #   decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, cpi <dbl>, ppp <dbl>,
#> #   pop <dbl>, gdp <dbl>, hfce <dbl>, is_interpolated <lgl>, …

Other features

Get estimates when survey year is not available

The fill_gaps argument will trigger the interpolation / extrapolation of poverty estimates when survey year is not available.

# fill_gaps = FALSE (default)
get_stats(country = "HTI")
#> # A tibble: 3 × 40
#>   region…¹ regio…² count…³ count…⁴  year repor…⁵ surve…⁶ surve…⁷ welfa…⁸ welfa…⁹
#>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>  
#> 1 Latin A… LAC     Haiti   HTI      2001 nation… ECVH    nation…    2001 income 
#> 2 Latin A… LAC     Haiti   HTI      2012 nation… ECVMAS  nation…    2012 consum…
#> 3 Latin A… LAC     Haiti   HTI      2012 nation… ECVMAS  nation…    2012 income 
#> # … with 30 more variables: survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>,
#> #   poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>,
#> #   gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>,
#> #   decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>,
#> #   decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, cpi <dbl>, ppp <dbl>,
#> #   pop <dbl>, gdp <dbl>, hfce <dbl>, is_interpolated <lgl>, …
# fill_gaps = TRUE
get_stats(country = "HTI", fill_gaps = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 39 × 40
#>    regio…¹ regio…² count…³ count…⁴  year repor…⁵ surve…⁶ surve…⁷ welfa…⁸ welfa…⁹
#>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1981 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  2 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1982 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  3 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1983 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  4 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1984 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  5 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1985 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  6 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1986 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  7 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1987 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  8 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1988 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#>  9 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1989 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#> 10 Latin … LAC     Haiti   HTI      1990 nation… NA      NA           NA income 
#> # … with 29 more rows, 30 more variables: survey_comparability <dbl>,
#> #   comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>,
#> #   median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>,
#> #   decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>,
#> #   decile7 <dbl>, decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, cpi <dbl>,
#> #   ppp <dbl>, pop <dbl>, gdp <dbl>, hfce <dbl>, is_interpolated <lgl>, …

Compute custom aggregates

get_stats() can also be used to compute aggregate welfare statistics of custom group of countries.

# World Bank aggregate
get_stats(country = "all", subgroup = "wb_regions")

# Custom aggregate
get_stats(country = c("CHL", "ARG", "BOL"), subgroup = "none")
